fullText:
“...this comedy of manners by the playwright Sandy Ruskin is so thoroughly old-fashioned that it may come as a surprise it’s not based — like so many Broadway outings lately are — on existing material. Which is not to say that any part of it feels original.”

Read more

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic dismisses the play as unoriginal and overly dated, with clear negative judgment on the material despite no explicit recommendation language. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong criticism of the show's originality and relevance, indicating a clear negative recommendation. | Note: Models differed by 13 points.
